Berkley Scholarship Program   Loan Programs   Teaching & Graduate Fellowships   Resources for Military Veterans   Resources for Social Enterprise   Tuition & Cost of Attendance     Admissions Request Information   Apply   Selection Criteria   Deadlines   Notification & Process   Application Instructions   Policies   Directors' Tips   FAQs     Meet With Us Visit Stern   Travel Directions   Events and Webinars   Videos   Day in the Life Student Videos   Podcasts   Virtual Tour   Contact a Student               Home / Programs & Admissions / Full-time MBA / Meet With Us / Day in the Life Student Videos                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Stern Unscripted: A Day in the Life of a Stern MBA  Follow four of our students for a day                                      Lyle Morton was an MBA/MPA dual degree student specializing in Finance and Social Innovation & Impact at Stern. He served as the President of the Social Enterprise Association (SEA) and Vice President of the Stern Campus Greening Initiative and founded the SEA New Orleans Trek. Lyle earned his B.A. in Political Science from Stanford University. He is pursuing a career in sustainability consulting in Washington, DC.     Introduction, Firms and Markets Class  Mock Interview with Office of Career Development  Stats Class, Stern Campus Greening Initiative Meeting  Networking Phone Call, Night Out in the Village                        Lola Bakare specialized in Entertainment, Media & Technology, Marketing, and Entrepreneurship & Innovation. A passionate leader in Stern's community, she served as Co-Editor-in-Chief of The Stern Opportunity (Stern's MBA newspaper) and VP of Student Recruitment for the Association of Hispanic and Black Business Students. Lola received her B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. She is pursuing a career in marketing at Dell in Austin, Texas.     Morning at the Palladium, Firms and Markets Class  Marketing Class, Stern Opportunity Meeting  Lunch with Friends, Statistics Class  Beer Blast                        Norma Marquez specialized in Finance. She served as VP of Events for the Latin American Business Association. Originally from Mexico, Norma received her undergraduate degree from Universidad Iberoamericana. She is pursuing a career in social enterprise in Mexico City.     Introduction, Managing Growing Companies Class  Lunch with Friends in the Village  Study Group Meeting, Asian Business Society Meeting  Bankruptcy Class                        Patrick Kosiek specialized in Finance, Strategy, and Business Law. He served as VP of Member Relations for the Graduate Finance Association and Director of Corporate Sponsors & Development for the Stern Private Equity Club. Patrick received his B.A. from Colgate University. He is pursuing his career in investment banking in New York City. Albeit untraditional, NYU is primarily located in Manhattan’s Greenwich Village and downtown Brooklyn where there’s no doubt that the neighborhoods feel like a community. Many of NYU’s academic and administrative buildings and freshman residence halls border Washington Square Park. The sidewalks are full of students on their way to class, and members of the NYU community fill the restaurants, shops, and other businesses. Both on campus and off, the people of NYU are directly involved...                continued below                                        This content requires the Macromedia Flash Player. Learn more                                                                                                                                                                               continued from above          ...in the day-to-day excitement, culture, and opportunity of the city that serves as a very real extension of NYU’s campus and classrooms.   Off campus, professors bring the experience they have as researchers and active professionals to their students. In addition to teaching, they serve as advisers to city government, banks, and school systems; consultants to museums and corporations; and working artists, choreographers, and film directors. Their professional experience informs their style of teaching and encourages students to make use of the extraordinary resources of the city through networking, research, internships, part-time jobs, and service learning.       On campus, NYU offers countless way to connect with other members of the University community. With over 400 student clubs and organizations, hundreds of sports and residence hall activities, guest lectures and film screenings, and city excursions and community service opportunities, students get involved with the University, with their college, in their residence hall, and most important, with each other.     Students and faculty have access to an exceptional range of facilities, services, residence halls, and dining locations. Academic facilities include nine libraries as well as dozens of specialized centers and institutes. Everyone has access to advanced computer resources and specialized offices that address almost every need—from medical attention to discount theatre tickets.                                                                               NYU Athletics        Support NYU Teams                   NYU athletic teams compete all year long both at home and away.            More                   University Stores and Supplies   New York University operates a number of bookstores offering a host of items ranging from textbooks to NYU t-shirts and hats to computers and software.
